title: Ticket #7398: Scary SECMAN messages during negotiation
description:
09/16/19 17:01:46 Can't open directory "/etc/condor/passwords.d" as PRIV_ROOT, errno: 2 (No such file or directory)
09/16/19 17:01:46 SECMAN: failed to create session <75.100.84.83:36143?addrs=75.100.84.83-36143&alias=azaphrael.org&noUDP&sock=schedd_26623_0e60_5>#1568671260#8 (key already exists).
09/16/19 17:01:46 SECMAN: existing session <75.100.84.83:36143?addrs=75.100.84.83-36143&alias=azaphrael.org&noUDP&sock=schedd_26623_0e60_5>#1568671260#8:

  1. /etc/condor/passwords.d is probably SEC_PASSWORD_DIRECTORY; this should be created by the RPM/DEB/tarball installer.
  2. We should remove the directory-missing warning entirely, or at least move it to D_SECURITY or D_FULLDEBUG.
  3. Both previous points apply to SEC_TOKEN_SYSTEM_DIRECTORY
  4. Having /etc/condor/<something> as a hard-coded default is really not helpful when running a personal condor. Param table defaults that aren't ETC itself should instead use $(ETC).
creator: tlmiller
